alert.note: Alert for Wayne (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 2:21PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Wayne County through 245 PM EDT... At 221 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mount Olive, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Goldsboro, Mount Olive, Walnut Creek, Mar-Mac, Brogden, Elroy and Cliffs Of The Neuse State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
